alert.note: Alert for Creek; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 17 at 9:34PM CDT until March 17 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Creek County in northeastern Oklahoma... West central Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... South central Tulsa County in northeastern Oklahoma... Eastern Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 933 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles southeast of Okfuskee, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Bixby... Okfuskee... Glenpool... Henryetta... Morris... Beggs... Mounds... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Boynton... Grayson... Clearview... Preston... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... Pharoah... Liberty... Bryant... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 223 and 237. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
